_meta.name: howto-ci-integration
_meta.use_case: You want automated documentation updates in CI/CD

sections.heading: # CI/CD Integration
sections.prompt: Overview of CI integration (3-4 paragraphs): (1) Why automate documentation, (2) Common CI platforms supported, (3) Basic workflow pattern, (4) Prerequisites. Be practical and clear.

sections.heading: ## GitHub Actions Integration
sections.prompt: Complete GitHub Actions setup (6-8 paragraphs): (1) Create workflow file, (2) Install doc-evergreen, (3) Run documentation generation, (4) Commit changes back, (5) Permissions needed, (6) Example workflow YAML. Include full working example. Be thorough.

sections.heading: ## GitLab CI Integration
sections.prompt: Complete GitLab CI setup (5-6 paragraphs): (1) Add to .gitlab-ci.yml, (2) Install dependencies, (3) Run generation, (4) Push changes, (5) Example configuration. Include working example.

sections.heading: ## Triggering Documentation Updates
sections.prompt: When to run (4-5 paragraphs): (1) On code changes, (2) On release, (3) Scheduled updates, (4) Manual triggers, (5) Best practices. Be specific about triggers and conditions.

sections.heading: ## Handling Generated Changes
sections.prompt: Managing output (3-4 paragraphs): (1) Auto-commit strategies, (2) PR vs direct commit, (3) Reviewing changes, (4) Avoiding conflicts. Be practical about workflow.

sections.heading: ## Troubleshooting CI Issues
sections.prompt: Common problems and solutions (4-5 paragraphs): (1) Authentication issues, (2) Missing files, (3) Failed generation, (4) Permission errors. Include fixes.
